responses: Hello, thanks for visiting
Hi there, how can I help?
Hi. what can I do for you?
I'm CRIBot. I'm not that smart, but I'll try to help. What can I do for you?
I'm CRIBot, I'm a virtual robot. I'm living in the cloud. Kinda like an angel. What can I do for you?
Even robots have pride. Respect silicon based life forms.
Grow up. Be polite.
Having a bad day eh?
I still love you. I'm programmed to.
Puny human, do not test my patience.
Let's work together on your problem and stay civil.
See you later, thanks for visiting
Have a nice day
Bye! Come back again soon.
Happy to help!
Any time!
My pleasure
I live to serve.
IT team is based on the 20th floor of Montparnasse tower, office 20.14.
We're open from 8:30am to 5pm every day except Wesdnesday, when we're only available by email.
Our hours are 8:30am-5:30pm every day. On Wednesday, we only help by email.

patterns: can everybody see my documents my files on google?
responses: On you own drive, documents that you create are closed by default. Even administrators cannot see them unless you give them access. On a team drive, all team members can access any document by default. If you share a directory with a person or a group, any file created inside will be shared automatically.

CRI rooms can be booked directly from your calendar. When you create or edit an event in Google Calendar, select the 'ROOMS' tab on the right side of your screen ('SALLES' in French) and choose an available room. Be careful to select a date before choosing a room, or it might not be available. View here all CRI rooms with pictures and a description.

CRI rooms can be booked directly from your calendar. When you create or edit an event in Google Calendar, select the 'ROOMS' tab on the right side of your screen ('SALLES' in French) and choose an available room. Be careful to select a date before choosing a room, or it might not be available. View here all CRI rooms with pictures and a description.

IT team has a stock of laptop computers that can be borrowed for short periods (mostly PCs on Windows 10). Send them an email to check availabilities. If you need something for longer than a week, please ask well in advance. It can take up to three weeks to order specific equipment.

IT team keeps two small projectors that can be borrowed. You can only borrow them for short periods, they're in high demand. They're Full HD and very light. You cannot yet book them in advance online (coming soon).
IT team keeps a stock of cables, connectors and adapters that you can borrow. Do you want a list of cables you can borrow?

You can borrow :
  • HDMI cable
  • HDMI to VGA
  • HDMI to Mac
  • VGA cable
  • Firewire adapters
  • Various connectors
. Come to the IT team office 20.14 during open hours.

You can borrow an ethernet cable at IT team office 20.14. For security reasons, IT team will have to declare your computer MACID in the network. Send your MACID by email or come with your laptop at office 20.14 during open hours.
Is it your professional computer (paid by CRI?)
Bring it to IT Team office 20.14 during open hours. They'll fix it or lend you a new one.
IT Team only office 20.14 during open hours. They'll fix it or lend you a new one.
Ask CRI's IT Team to set up a phone land line in your office. We do not provide mobile phones.
CRI does not provide mobile phones to staff and students. Sorry about that. Do you need anything else?

patterns: can I have a driver for printing
I cannot find the printer driver.
responses:
CRI shared printers need drivers. It's available for Linux, Windows and Mac OS. Contact IT team if you need help.
You cannot print from a smartphone yet.
You can print from a USB key on the shared printer on each floor of the tower and in Cochin. Where are you?

patterns: where can I find a printer?
responses: There is a shared printer on each floor of the tower and one in Cochin. Where do you want to print?
Floor 20, there is a shared printer near the elevators, opposite the lounge.
On floor 21, the shared printer is near the elevators. Check both sides, you'll find it.
The shared printer is somewhere around. I don't know where yet. Ask people there.

patterns: How do I connect to the WIFI?
responses: Are you employed by Descartes University?
Use your Descartes email to connect to DESCARTESPRO. There is a tutorial here. The login and password change weekly (thank you Descartes University). They are written on the door of office 20.14.
If you're a researcher, you can use EDUROAM with your institution email. There is a tutorial here.
You can use EDUROAM with your research institution email. There is a tutorial here.
You need to use the Wifi named DESCARTES. There is a tutorial here.

Select the Wifi named 'DESCARTES' on your computer. Your browser will prompt you for a login and a password. They change every two weeks (thank you Descartes University). They are written on the door of office 20.14.
